conclusion: Analyze processes to determine heat absorbed vs. released.
Cycle consists of four parts: a to b, b to c, c to d, d to a.
a to b is an isochoric process.
b to c is an adiabatic process.
c to d is an isobaric process.
d to a is an adiabatic process.
Work done during isochoric process is zero.
No heat exchanged during isochoric process, Q_ab = 0.
No heat exchange during adiabatic process, Q_bc = 0.
Work done during isobaric process is W_cd = P(V_4 - V_3).
Heat added during isobaric process is Q_cd = W_cd + Î”U.
No heat exchange during adiabatic process, Q_da = 0.
Net change in internal energy over one cycle is zero.
Q_cd = 0 based on previous heat values.
Sign of Q_cd indicates heat released during c to d.
Heat released is greater than heat absorbed.
Final answer: Heat released is greater than heat absorbed.
